citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Environmental Conservation, Exxon Valdez Oil Spill Restoration Office
citeinfo.title: EVOS Aerial Overflights

descript.abstract: Data Type: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill; The database records information collected during over flights of Prince William Sound following the Exxon Valdez oil spill. The dataset consists of automated maps and an associated database.

idinfo.accconst: Data is to be shared among public agencies and the public, although allowances are made for confidentiality prior to publication of findings.
idinfo.useconst: Beach segment/subdivision numbering system has been modified over the course of data collection. Knowledge of this system is necessary for accurate interpretation of this data.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: Data is to be shared among public agencies and the public, although allowances are made for confidentiality prior to publication of findings.
metainfo.metuc: Beach segment/subdivision numbering system has been modified over the course of data collection. Knowledge of this system is necessary for accurate interpretation of this data.
